FeedItems.Title: Announcing NuGet 6.4 – Signed, Central, Delivered
FeedItems.Summary:
NuGet 6.4 is included in Visual Studio 2022 and .NET 7.0 out of the box. You can also download NuGet 6.4 for Windows, macOS, and Linux as a standalone executable.

FeedItems.Summary:
NuGet.org will begin requiring two-factor authentication for accounts starting March 8th.
The post Requiring two-factor authentication on NuGet.org appeared first on The NuGet Blog.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Box around the TFM section arrows is hidden by the box below it" (#9375) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The box around the framework generation collapsible arrows (when they're selected/in focus) is distorted by the box below it. Some of the bottom part of the box gets hidden.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] TFM section should be expanded on page load if a TFM is selected" (#9370) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
All TFM sections are collapsed when the page loads, even if a TFM is selected, because of which users can't see their selected TFMs.

### Solution
If any individual TFMs have been selected, their TFM sections should be expanded when the page loads.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] packageType param should appear after frameworks and tfms in the url" (#9371) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The packageType query parameter appears before frameworks and tfms in the url, but appears after them in the UI.

### Solution
The frameworks and tfms params should appear before packageType in the url.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Frameworks and tfms params have a trailing comma" (#9369) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The frameworks and tfms parameters always end in a comma (`net,` ; `net5.0,net472,`).

### Solution
Remove the trailing comma.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Frameworks and tfms params not ordered correctly" (#9368) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The frameworks and tfms parameters are being added to the query string in the order that the user selects them, rather than the order of the checkboxes in the UI.

### Solution
Frameworks and tfms should appear in the url in the order they appear in the UI.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[Search-by-TFM Bug Bash] Prerel parameter uppercase/lowercase inconsistency" (#9367) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Problem description
The Prerelease url parameter sometimes has an uppercase boolean ('True') and sometimes a lowercase boolean ('true').

### Solution
It should always show a lowercase boolean.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: A second search bar blinks when changing the selection of "Sort by"" (#9376) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Describe the bug

When changing the selection of "Sort by", a second search bar is shown and then disappears.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41028779/216483097-ec029bc6-a913-44a1-bf0b-99bff2fbeb75.png)

### Repro Steps

1. Go to the search page in Gallery
2. Change the selection of "Sort by"
3. A second search bar blinks

### Expected Behavior

It should not blink for a better experience.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[NuGet.org Bug]: The search bar disappears when browsing packages under a package owner" (#9377) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Impact

I'm unable to use NuGet.org

### Describe the bug

I remember that there is always a search bar when browsing packages under a package owner, but it disappears recently:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41028779/216486932-d0917271-fbde-4db6-95d8-238be16a6314.png)

Actually, when I refresh the page, I can see that the search bar blinks and then disappears.


### Repro Steps

1. Go to a package owner profile page: https://www.nuget.org/profiles/dotnetframework
2. No search bar any more
3. Refresh the page, and the search bar blinks.

### Expected Behavior

The search bar should be there as before when browsing packages under a package owner.

### Screenshots

_No response_

### Additional Context and logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Advanced search filters get reset when changing search parameters" (#8660) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### Describe the bug

When refining a package search on nuget.org, you often modify your current advanced search filter, or query term, or both at the same time. Currently either the changed search filter or change query term is respected, depending on whether you click the search filter "Apply" button or the query term "Search" button.

### To Reproduce

1. Go to www.nuget.org
2. Search for "json", https://www.nuget.org/packages?q=json
3. Expand the filter button, sort by downloads, and press apply, https://www.nuget.org/packages?packagetype=&sortby=totalDownloads-desc&q=json&prerel=True
4. Search for "xml"

Note that the "sort by downloads" option is no longer applied.

### Expected behavior

The advanced search filters (sorting by downloads) should remain.

Pressing either the search button or the apply button should use the latest entries in all form fields.

### Screenshots

![Animation](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/94054/123324773-0f5c2700-d4ec-11eb-8740-9fd40fc1e64a.gif)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Survey] Repo Contribution Experience Survey 2023" (#9384) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
### **How are we doing? Let us know!**

We want to know how we're doing as maintainers. Fill out the survey in the link below and tell us what you think.

Whether you've been involved for years or you're relatively new please tell us about your experience participating and contributing to the project. It should only take a few minutes, and you can answer for up to 3 repos:

https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/8KTX9VT?Source=RepoLink

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Search-by-TFM Bug Bash feedback" (#9366) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9367,
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9368,
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9369,
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9370,
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9371,
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9375,
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9377,
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9376

This PR addresses some of the issues flagged by the Search-by-TFM bug bash:

1. The Prerelease url parameter sometimes had an uppercase boolean ('True') and sometimes a lowercase boolean ('true'). It will always show a lowercase boolean now. 
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9367
2. The frameworks and tfms parameters were being added to the query string in the order that the user selected them, rather than the order of the checkboxes in the UI. This has been fixed.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9368
3. The frameworks and tfms parameters always ended in a comma (`net,` ; `net5.0,net472,`). This has been fixed.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9369
4. Previously, all TFM sections were always collapsed when the page loaded. Now, if any individual TFMs have been selected, their TFM sections will be expanded when the page loads.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9370
5. The packageType query parameter was before frameworks and tfms in the url, but appears after them in the UI. This has been fixed so that the frameworks and tfms params appear before packageType in the url.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9371
6. The box around the framework generation collapsible arrows (when they're selected/in focus) was distorted by the box below it. Some of the bottom part of the box was hidden. This has been fixed.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9375

**UPDATE:** Added a small fix that addresses 2 other bugs:
1. Search bar disappears on the Profiles page. We needed to remove the default search bar on the Search page, but the search bar was being removed from the Profiles page too with the same javascript code. We now use a ViewBag property, the same way that the [Home page](https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/60fc5d5b8a5211a47d3722199ff459e660c59823/src/NuGetGallery/Views/Pages/Home.cshtml#L4) does, instead of javascript. With these changes, the search bar removal will only happen on the Search page.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9377
2. An extra Search bar flickers before disappearing when the search page is rendering. The switch from the javascript code to the ViewBag property fixes this too.
https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/9376

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget package installation with  --interactive option has different flags for IsNonInteractive flag (sdk 7.0.102 vs 7.0.2xx-preview1)" (#12405) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe

### Product Version

7.0.102

### Worked before?

Yes, it works in Net 6.0 and in sdk 7.0.2xx-preview1

### Impact

I'm unable to use this version

### Repro Steps & Context

The initial ticket was cleated in templating repo:
https://github.com/dotnet/templating/issues/6020

We were able to repro locally and the only difference in the outputs that influence the result is **IsNonInteractive** values. Please see the attached logs.

From the templating point of view, there is no changes between 7.0.102 and 7.0.2 in [InitializeNuGetCredentialService](https://github.com/dotnet/sdk/blob/bfbcfe92e8df98f04dc5e1a8835b0270176f4b67/src/Cli/Microsoft.TemplateEngine.Cli/TemplatePackageCoordinator.cs#L192-L195:~:text=private%20static%20void-,InitializeNuGetCredentialService(bool%20interactive),-%7B)


### Verbose Logs

7.0.100

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Icon is not shown for self hosted package" (#12425) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

MSBuild.exe

### Product Version

17.4.1+9a89d02ff 

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

1. Create your own package with an icon defined in the MyLib.csproj
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Project ToolsVersion="15.0" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/developer/msbuild/2003">
   <PropertyGroup>
       <PackageIcon>icon.png</PackageIcon>
   </PropertyGroup>
   <ItemGroup>
       <None Include="icon.png" Pack="true" Visible="false" PackagePath="" />
   </ItemGroup>
</Project>

2. Use MSBuild for packaging

MSBuild .\MyLib.csproj -t:Pack -p:Configuration=Release

3. Publish the package to JFrog Artifactory using JFrog CLI

cd bin/Release
jf rt u "*.nupkg" myrepo-nuget/MyLib/
jf rt u "*.snupkg" myrepo-nuget/MyLib/

3. Icon does not show up neither in JFrog Artifactory nor in the package list in JetBrains Rider.

4. icon.png file is included into the .nupkg archive

5. The resulting MyLib.nuspec includes  <icon>icon.png</icon> in the metadata section, and is missing any files or contentFiles sections.

### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NU5104 (stable package should not use prerelease) should not warn when upper version uses -0" (#12424) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product Used

dotnet.exe, MSBuild.exe, NuGet.exe

### Product Version

all

### Worked before?

_No response_

### Impact

It bothers me. A fix would be nice

### Repro Steps & Context

NU5104 basically says that SemVer stable versions of packages should not take dependencies on prelreease versions of packages. According to https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6434#issuecomment-1323572424 this warning triggers when the version range `[1.0.0, 2.0.0-0)` is specified.

However, and upper exclusive range of `2.0.0-0` explicitly means that no pre-release version of 2.0.0 will match since `-0` is the lowest possible prerelease version, and exclusive bound means that it won't allow the exact match. Therefore, the `-0` and the NU5104 are trying to achieve the exact same thing, so it shouldn't be warning.


### Verbose Logs

_No response_

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Warning when version range upper version does not end in `-0`" (#12423) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
### NuGet Product(s) Involved

NuGet.exe, MSBuild.exe, dotnet.exe

### The Elevator Pitch

According to SemVer2, 1.0.0 < 2.0.0-alpha < 2.0.0.  But customers frequently use range `[1.2.3, 2.0.0)` hoping to limit the range to `1.x`, but this doesn't take into account pre-release versions.

Therefore, I propose a warning when:
* it finds a package where an upper version is specified
* the upper version is not inclusive (`)` rather than `]`)
* the upper version does not have a prerelease label, then a warning is shown.

Something similar to:

> Warning NUxxxx: Package Contoso.Utilities requests versions [1.2.3, 2.0.0) but will match pre-release version such as 2.0.0-alpha. To exclude prerelease versions, change the version range to [1.2.3, 2.0.0-0)

I'm not sure if this should only be a pack warning (dependency version), only be a restore warning (PackageReference version), or both.

### Additional Context and Details

Consider issues like:
* https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/6434
* https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/12082

I agree that the behaviour is non-intuitive, and that many customers would prefer the version range comparison to exclude the pre-release versions instead, but it's a breaking change whose magnitude of impact is unknown. This proposal could help package authors in particular minimize risk that their packages claim compatibility with pre-release packages.
